content:
I've outlined my idea here:
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/703

Would love to get feedback.

Help wanted - Blog post to encourage folks to help in final push for 1.17 · Issue #703 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
I had an interesting thought. We're about 8-9 days from feature freeze and we all probably have a few issues that we'd like to see get more attention. There MAY BE a few folks out there wit...
Great idea @StPaulTim! I'd suggest adding the title of each issue (or at least a shortened version of it) to the blog post.
Sure. I didn't do that to start, because some of the titles are long and/or confusing. But, we could try to come up with a shortened version.
Instead of title, I went with a brief description of each issue. But, we could do both.

This might be a good idea to get help from new folks, but it might also just be a good opportunity for us to remind each other what our personal priorities are right now and where we can best help each other.
Participation would be voluntary.
Have added the issue I'm advocating for currently.
I added issues titles (or shortened versions) to mine.

Thanks @BWPanda and @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) for the feedback. Anyone else have thoughts on:
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/703

Help wanted - Blog post to encourage folks to help in final push for 1.17 · Issue #703 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
I had an interesting thought. We're about 8-9 days from feature freeze and we all probably have a few issues that we'd like to see get more attention. There MAY BE a few folks out there wit...
Excellent idea, although I'm yet not sure if I have the time to add something for this release.

@Laryn has also added some issues. That is three of us. I believe that @jenlampton will be adding some shortly. I may publish any time now this afternoon. We can continue to add or edit this post all week.

I just published the blog post and will start to promote on social media shortly. We can continue to add issues anytime. If you have edit access, feel free to add them yourself OR just post a note here in this topic and I'll update the blog post myself (even help with the summary text).

@StPaulTim Please add this issue to the list: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4022
Thank You!

[UX] Missing translation function calls · Issue #4022 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the bug Missing translation function calls in node.module and standard.install. Localization needs these. Unable to translate some terms of the installation process and the initial p...
@Attila Vasas I'll add it

@Attila Vasas How does this look?

https://backdropcms.org/news/help-wanted-finalizing-backdrop-cms-1170
Perfect! Thanks @StPaulTim ++
stpaultim GG (Karma: 22)

Well, it's only been about 3 hours and we already have merged and closed an issue that was listed in the blog post. ;-)

Let's close a few more...

@StPaulTim Here are three more suggestions for the blog post:

  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/1928, (was nearly ready but) needs some work
  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2637, needs code review
  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4290, needs testing and code review
Views UI: Fix "Replacement patterns" visibility for Global: Custom Text · Issue #1928 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
In the views UI when adding a global text field I see the following description text: You may enter data from this view as per the "Replacement patterns" below. But there is no "Repl...
Transliteration doesn't respect site default language · Issue #2637 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
PR by @olafgrabienski: backdrop/backdrop#1849 (outdated) PR by @quicksketch: backdrop/backdrop#1850 (outdated, conflicts) PR by @indigoxela: backdrop/backdrop#3175 (set node langcode, closed in fav...
[UX] Improve the description text on the block class field · Issue #4290 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
We had a forum post where someone asked if it was the class name that goes in here or the CSS code. Let's update the description text to indicate that the class name goes in here. Proposed text...
@Olaf Grabienski - I added your issues. Please review my summary. https://backdropcms.org/news/help-wanted-finalizing-backdrop-cms-1170
Thanks a lot, @StPaulTim - will have a look now!
• Description for issue 1928 looks good! That many labels seem a bit overwhelming to me, though. Maybe Pull request needs new approach or something along those lines?

• Labels and description for issue 2637 look both good. We could mention there is more than one PR, so people are not too confused when they go to the issue. Suggestion: "We have several pull requests and need more eyes on the code of the current one to see if we are doing this the best way.
Yes, I was confused when I looked at issue, but I was able to figure it out.
(I'll try to clarify things in the issue description.)
Thanks. That would be my suggestion.
An issue like this needs a issue summary update from time to time.
Finally, in the labels of issue 4290 seems to be a typo: Pull feedback on proposed change to help text
Yes, my bad.
Should probably be Pull request needs feedback ...

I think that was my original idea, but I was trying to change it to: "Needs feedback on proposed change to help text" - because that is a lot less technical. This is an issue for someone without any coding skills to offer input, so why mention Pull Request.
On that issue, someone could offer useful feedback without looking at code or even going into the sandbox.

We did a blog post before the release of 1.17 where anyone could list up to three issues that they most wanted to draw attention to (get help with). Should we do this again?

For those who can see draft blog posts: https://backdropcms.org/news/help-wanted-finalizing-backdrop-cms-1180

The one from last release is no longer published, but here is the archived version:
https://backdropcms.org/news/help-wanted-finalizing-backdrop-cms-1170

Here is the Github issue: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/703

Help wanted - Blog post to encourage folks to help in final push for 1.17 · Issue #703 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
I had an interesting thought. We're about 8-9 days from feature freeze and we all probably have a few issues that we'd like to see get more attention. There MAY BE a few folks out there wit...

Is there any interest in trying this blog post again?
https://backdropcms.org/news/help-wanted-finalizing-backdrop-cms-1180
Sentiment in the DEV meeting was to go ahead and try this blog post again. Please, let me know what issues that you most want help with for the 1.18 release.
@StPaulTim I get a "Access denied" for the blog post.
@Olaf Grabienski it's still unpublished. You should try to access it after logging into b.org.

I was hoping to get more issues listed before publishing it. But, I've published it now to make it easier to see. I will update it with additional issues from other users as soon as them come in.
https://backdropcms.org/news/help-wanted-finalizing-backdrop-cms-1180

Remember that we'll have a virtual sprint room open tomorrow (Dec 13th) from 12:00-4:00pm (Pacific Time). See event listing for time in other time zones.
https://backdropcms.org/news/events/contribution-sprint-for-118
Feel free to drop by anytime for as long or as little as you like.

Here is one of my favorites: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2069

[UX] Date format tokens for date field missing · Issue #2069 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need We can customize the format of the [node:created] and [node:updated] tokens, by adding custom followed by the date format, like so: [node:created:custom:Y-m-d]. But adding c...

@Olaf Grabienski - I added your issue to blog post. Anyone else looking for help with an issue for 1.18?
https://backdropcms.org/news/help-wanted-finalizing-backdrop-cms-1180
All the advocate issues I guess...

I got most of them, but may be missing a few. Anyone else have anything they want added to the list. You can have more than one, but no more than 3. https://backdropcms.org/news/help-wanted-finalizing-backdrop-cms-1180

I'd be game for getting this squeezed in: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4728

It might be a bit crude initially unless we get the UX hammered out, but at least the foundation would be there.

Might see what @jenlampton wants to do with it.

Expose Fields to Visibility Conditions · Issue #4728 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need Long story short, I'm coming from D7 Panels to BackDrop Layouts. It's a bit of an adjustment, but I'm finding that "most" of the things that are done i...
That'd be a nice addition for 1.18.0 @Phil Ward :+1:

Anyone else looking for help with an issue for 1.18?

Besides begging for code review and/or testing? :laughter_tears: Honestly, I'm no advocate for any new feature ATM but still try to get some bugs fixed - maybe 1.18, maybe 1.17.5, but hopefully in near future.

@StPaulTim Maybe you are willing to throw in some decimals into a field?

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3792

Simple decimals fail to pass validation · Issue #3792 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the bug I am running into a problem where a number/decimal field is not allowing values that should pass the validation. It is possibly related to this Drupal 8 issue? Not certain bu...

@StPaulTim I just saw in the tweet that bug fix issues can also go in the blog post. I have this one (needs code review): https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3008

symlink to document root causing module update issues · Issue #3008 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Describe your issue or idea When attempting to update on_the_web module using the updater at admin/modules/update, my update succeeded on my local site, but failed on my live site, with the followi...

Honestly, I'm no advocate for any new feature ATM but still try to get some bugs fixed - maybe 1.18, maybe 1.17.5, but hopefully in near future.

Just to be clear, this list could apply to 1.18 or 1.17.5 and can include bug fixes. You don't have to be the advocate for these issues, it's just a chance to draw attention to an issue you care about. It's all pretty informal.

Maybe you are willing to throw in some decimals into a field?

@indigoxela I did it. PR works for me. Let me know if I tested it correctly. Willing to try again if you think I should be testing something different.

Let me know if I tested it correctly

@StPaulTim Yes, absolutely. Many thanks for testing!
